intro: Echinocactus curvispinus, commonly known as the hooked spine cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a columnar cactus with thick, ribbed stems that can grow up to several meters in height. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers during the summer months. Its spines are modified leaves that help reduce water loss and provide protection from herbivores. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
